initial_story:
The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.
stories:
The Eurovision Song Contest is just around the corner and this year, it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden.

You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

"I'm feeling pretty good," Olly tells De-Graft.

"It's been a long time coming and I'm just really excited to be part of the Eurovision family."

And as for his song, Dizzy, Olly reveals that it's all about how he felt after winning the contest in 2023.

"I was so dizzy with happiness and excitement that I just wanted to write a song about it."

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

But what does the future hold for Olly?

Only time will tell, but one thing's for sure - he's definitely got the Eurovision bug!

"I'm feeling pretty good," Olly tells De-Graft.

"It's been a long time coming and I'm just really excited to be part of the Eurovision family."

"I was so dizzy with happiness and excitement that I just wanted to write a song about it."

The Eurovision Song Contest is back, and this year it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden! You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

"I'm feeling pretty good," Olly tells De-Graft.

"It's been a long time coming and I'm just really excited to be part of the Eurovision family."

And as for his song, Dizzy, Olly reveals that it's all about how he felt after winning the contest in 2023.

"I was so dizzy with happiness and excitement that I just wanted to write a song about it."

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

The Eurovision Song Contest is back, and this year it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden! You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

"I'm feeling pretty good," Olly tells De-Graft.

"It's been a long time coming and I'm just really excited to be part of the Eurovision family."

And as for his song, Dizzy, Olly reveals that it's all about how he felt after winning the contest in 2023.

"I was so dizzy with happiness and excitement that I just wanted to write a song about it."

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

"I'm feeling pretty good," Olly tells De-Graft.

"It's been a long time coming and I'm just really excited to be part of the Eurovision family."

And as for his song, Dizzy, Olly reveals that it's all about how he felt after winning the contest in 2023.

"I was so dizzy with happiness and excitement that I just wanted to write a song about it."

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

The Eurovision Song Contest is back, and this year it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden! You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

"I'm feeling pretty good," Olly tells De-Graft.

"It's been a long time coming and I'm just really excited to be part of the Eurovision family."

And as for his song, Dizzy, Olly reveals that it's all about how he felt after winning the contest in 2023.

"I was so dizzy with happiness and excitement that I just wanted to write a song about it."

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

"I'm feeling pretty good," Olly tells De-Graft.

"It's been a long time coming and I'm just really excited to be part of the Eurovision family."

And as for his song, Dizzy, Olly reveals that it's all about how he felt after winning the contest in 2023.

"I was so dizzy with happiness and excitement that I just wanted to write a song about it."

The Eurovision Song Contest is back, and this year it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden! You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

"I'm feeling pretty good," Olly tells De-Graft.

"It's been a long time coming and I'm just really excited to be part of the Eurovision family."

And as for his song, Dizzy, Olly reveals that it's all about how he felt after winning the contest in 2023.

"I was so dizzy with happiness and excitement that I just wanted to write a song about it."

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

The Eurovision Song Contest is back, and this year it's taking place in Malmo, Sweden! You can find out all about the event right here.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

"I'm feeling pretty good," Olly tells De-Graft.

"It's been a long time coming and I'm just really excited to be part of the Eurovision family."

And as for his song, Dizzy, Olly reveals that it's all about how he felt after winning the contest in 2023.

"I was so dizzy with happiness and excitement that I just wanted to write a song about it."

The Eurovision Song contest Grand Final will be shown on BBC One and iPlayer on Saturday 11 May.

The UK's entry for 2024 is Olly Alexander who'll be performing his song, Dizzy.

But how's he feeling ahead of the big night, where he'll perform in front of 200 million people!

De-Graft sat down with him to find out all about his preparation for the competition.

"I'm feeling pretty good," Olly tells De-Graft.

"It's been a long time coming and I'm just really excited to be part of the Eurovision family."

And as for his song, Dizzy, Olly reveals that it's all about how he felt after winning the contest in 2023.

"I was so dizzy with happiness and excitement that I just wanted to write a song about it."
